item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Nothing is so firmly believed as that which we least know." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I find I am much prouder of the victory I obtain over myself, when, in the very ardor of dispute, I make myself submit to my adversaryâ€™s force of reason, than I am pleased with the victory I obtain over him through his weakness." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I enjoy books as misers enjoy treasures, because I know I can enjoy them whenever I please." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Life itself is neither a good nor an evil: life is where good or evil find a place, depending on how you make it for them." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description:
"And therefore, Reader, I myself am the subject of my book: it is not reasonable that you should employ your leisure on a topic so frivolous and so vain.
Therefore, Farewell:" -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I had rather complain of ill-fortune than be ashamed of victory." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Poppy add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Poppy add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "The truly free man is the one who can turn down an invitation to dinner without giving an excuse." -- Jules Renard
